newsitem.title: CHINA: China '96 coal output seen 1.35 bln T, up 4.6 pct.
newsitem.headline: China '96 coal output seen 1.35 bln T, up 4.6 pct.

text.p: China's coal output was expected to reach 1.35 billion tonnes in 1996, up 4.6 percent from last year, the Xinhua news agency quoted Coal Minister Wang Senhao as saying on Thursday.
China's coal production had shown a 60-million-tonne increase compared with 1995, Wang told a national meeting.
Of China's 93 key state-owned coal mines, 55 were profitable this year, doubling from 26 in 1995 and cutting industry losses by 1.7 billion yuan ($205 million), he said.
These mines had also made 1.55 billion yuan in profits from sideline undertakings, showing an increase of 53.4 percent over last year, he said without elaborating.
Wang attributed this year's heightened productivity to the addition of 70 new coal mines as well as an increase in the number of fully mechanised coal-cutting teams, it said.

China has said it would open at least 300 coal projects to foreign investors with priority to projects in pit-head power plants, coal transport facilities and coal-bed methane. It has not said whether investors could export output.
